items.title: Exercise 1: CRM Implementation Update
items.text:
Strategy Brief: Q4 CRM Migration

Next quarter, we will be transitioning to a new omnichannel CRM platform. This move is designed to enhance our customer journey and reduce the friction at key touchpoints. 

By December 31st, we will have migrated all active customer records from the legacy system. During the transition, the support team will be monitoring the churn rate closely to ensure no customers are lost. 

By this time next year, we will have been using the new system for 12 months, and we expect that our NPS will have increased by at least 15 points. We will be providing training sessions throughout October.

questions.question: When will the migration of customer records be finished?
questions.explanation: The text states: 'By December 31st, we will have migrated all active customer records'.

questions.question: Which verb tense is used to describe an action that will be ongoing in October?
questions.explanation: 'We will be providing training sessions' is future continuous, describing an ongoing action.

items.prompt: Exercise 2: CX Vocabulary. What does 'NPS' measure?
items.explanation: NPS is a metric for customer loyalty and satisfaction.

items.prompt: Exercise 3: Future Perfect. Complete the sentence: 'By the time the manager arrives, the team ____ (finalize) the NPS report.'
items.modelAnswer: By the time the manager arrives, the team will have finalized the NPS report.

items.prompt: Exercise 4: Future Continuous. Complete the sentence: 'This time tomorrow, I ____ (train) the new staff on the CRM software.'
items.modelAnswer: This time tomorrow, I will be training the new staff on the CRM software.

items.prompt: Exercise 5: CX Chunks. To 'reduce the churn rate' means:
options: To increase the number of customers leaving
To decrease the percentage of customers who stop using the service
To buy a new butter churn for the kitchen
To fire the customer service manager
items.explanation: Churn reduction is about improving customer retention.
